subtitle: hi I'm Simon Jacobson welcome to
meaningful Monday's where we answer your
personal questions the question for this
week is I grew up with an abusive father
I've done my own healing but I know that
he's still a miserable person even
though he was extremely mean during my
childhood I can't help but feel bad for
him he is still a miserable person his
second wife just left him I spent a long
time very angry at him but he's still my
father and for better or for worse part
of me loves him what could I do to help
them I wish that he would deal with his
anger issues and learned to stop lashing
out well my heart goes out to anyone in
this situation and let me say a few
things first of all before helping your
father you may have to first help
yourself like when we're on planes and
they say the oxygen masks come down
first put the oxygen mask in yourself
before you put it on someone else
because if you're in the line of fire
and you're still a meshed and entangled
with an abusive father you may not be in
a position to really help them much
because to bein things that happen when
a father is abusive because we have such
connection to our fathers and because
there is love and there shortly even in
abusive relationship moments with his
deep love we either become pleasers and
enablers or we become extremely bitter
and angry and rebellious and both of
them are still reacting to your father
so first thing is you have to find out
who you are independent of your father
clearly you're aware of the situation so
the most important thing is to get your
life together is your life working have
you found the proper spouse have you
been able to build a family have you
built a strong secure base in your life
if the answer is yes and things are
going well there you're far stronger
position to go back and now deal with
your father if the answer is no and
you're suffering then to just feel bad
for your father it's a beautiful
compassionate reaction but it's not
helping you with your life your life
comes first and
then by all means do everything you can
to help your father but if you're
drowning you're not going to be able to
help someone else that's drowned from
the tone of this it sounds like there's
still problems and the fact that there's
still a type of abuse that may be coming
your way so I say to you the following
you have to get out of the line of fire
you have no obligation to honor your
father that's abusing you you have to
find ways to take care of yourself and
then by all means pray for your father
out of strength maybe find the right
people that can deal with him but the
worst thing is for you to suddenly
become someone is going to fix him or
try to fix all the problems that he's
caused in your life and your family's
life this by no means is not being
compassionate to your father definitely
needs help but no one can help someone
that doesn't help themselves let alone a
child he will need his professionals and
let him do what he has to do but it
cannot be bound to your growth and to
your development and sometimes yes
sometimes we have to just pray for our
fathers in our own privacy because
that's the only thing that may work that
God may be compassionate and that he
will see the light and deal with his own
anger issues but I've of all my answers
to you how to get your life together and
make sure you're healthy healthy you are
the more healthier way you'll be able to
help your father thank you for watching
I welcome your personal questions have a
meaningful week
